Package it.polimi.ingsw.model

Class ProductionHandler

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.model.ProductionHandler
All Implemented Interfaces:
Observable
public class ProductionHandler
extends java.lang.Object
implements Observable
This class was made to simplify the interaction between PlayerBoard and Production classes during a single turn. It holds the information about every Production the player can activate during his turn so that the player can select all the Productions he wants to activate and then all the selected Productions can be activated at the same time at the end of the turn

  • Method Details

    • addProduction

      public void addProduction​(Production production)
      Adds the specified Production to the player's ProductionHandler
      Parameters:
      production - specifies the Production to be added

    • removeProduction

      public void removeProduction​(Production production) throws ProductionNotPresentException
      Removes the specified Production from the player's ProductionHandler
      Parameters:
      production - specifies the Production to be removed
      Throws:
      ProductionNotPresentException - if there is no production corresponding to the give number

    • chooseJollyInput

      public void chooseJollyInput​(Resource resource) throws NotEnoughResourceException
      Removes the first ResourceJolly it finds in currentInput and replaces it with the specified Resource. Throws RuntimeException if it doesn't find any ResourceJolly.
      Parameters:
      resource - specifies the Resource that is going to replace the ResourceJolly
      Throws:
      NotEnoughResourceException - if the productions' input does not contain any more jollies

    • chooseJollyOutput

      public void chooseJollyOutput​(Resource resource) throws NotEnoughResourceException
      Removes the first ResourceJolly it finds in currentOutput and replaces it with the specified Resource. Throws RuntimeException if it doesn't find any ResourceJolly.
      Parameters:
      resource - specifies the Resource that is going to replace the ResourceJolly
      Throws:
      NotEnoughResourceException - if the productions' input does not contain any more jollies

    • selectProduction

      public void selectProduction​(int productionNumber) throws ProductionNotPresentException
      Marks the specified Production as selected and updates currentInput and currentOutput lists. At the end of the turn, only selected Productions will be activated
      Parameters:
      productionNumber - indicates the position of the required production inside the list
      Throws:
      ProductionNotPresentException - if there is no production corresponding to the given number

    • selectProductionByID

      public void selectProductionByID​(int productionID) throws ProductionNotPresentException
      Marks the specified Production as selected and updates currentInput and currentOutput lists. At the end of the turn, only selected Productions will be activated
      Parameters:
      productionID - indicates the ID of the required production
      Throws:
      ProductionNotPresentException - if there is no production corresponding to the given id

    • resetProductionChoice

      public void resetProductionChoice()
      Unselects all the Productions in the ProductionHandler and clears currentInput and currentOutput lists.

    • arePlayerResourcesEnough

      public boolean arePlayerResourcesEnough​(PlayerBoard playerBoard) throws UndefinedJollyException, NotEnoughResourceException
      Returns whether or not the player has enough resources to activate the currently selected productions. If the player does not have the required resources, throws an exception so as to be able to communicate which is missing
      Parameters:
      playerBoard - specifies which PlayerBoard to control in order to ensure that it has enough Resources
      Returns:
      true if the player has enough resources (considering the entirety of his storage) to activate all the Productions he selected
      Throws:
      UndefinedJollyException - if there are still UnknownResources in input or output lists (the exception message will specify if they're in input or output)
      NotEnoughResourceException - if the player does not have enough resources

    • releaseInput

      public void releaseInput​(PlayerBoard playerBoard)
      Adds to the player's waiting room the resources in the active productions input
      Parameters:
      playerBoard - the player's board

    • releaseOutput

      public void releaseOutput​(PlayerBoard playerBoard)
      Adds to the player's strongbox the resources in the active productions output
      Parameters:
      playerBoard - the player's board

      Parameters:
